text: hi everyone the Anthony Fantino here
Internet's busiest music nerd and it's
time for a review torch her mana craft
I'm saying a torch it's how I'm gonna
say it
torch these guys are a florida-based
doom stoner sludge metal band that I've
been a fan of for years now around five
years or so but this is the first time
I'm actually reviewing any music of
theirs torch does not really have the
best or most celebrated sound in this
style of music but nonetheless they are
in their own lane especially on this new
album hermano craft torch is a part of
this new breed of metal group that
emphasizes thickness heaviness just
brutal rumbling guitar riffs just the
kind of sonic frequencies that
specialize and just reach down in your
gun shakin everything up but I would not
say especially these days with with this
album torches style does not come off
brooding or dark or overly aggressive
like a lot of bands that perform this
kind of music and a lot of elements add
up to this feeling for one instead of
very screamed or forceful vocals
frontman Steve Brooks sings in a very
clean delivery and he always gets his
vocals mixed in a way where they just
soar over the mix leaving this jet
stream of of firework explosions and
rainbows behind the distortion on the
guitars isn't too abrasive it feels much
brighter this time around in comparison
with the band's last full-length LP
meander fall the band pumps out a lot of
songs and a very punked out manners
sticking to lengths that are around
sometimes one to two minutes and the
hooks
this LPR extremely catchy which is to be
expected with torch and even though
their brand of stoner metal has always
had a really strong early strong element
of melody in some songs that is just
increased tenfold on this album and it's
kind of added up into some tracks that
to me feel a little bit like a power
ballad or like an arena rock song
something that I really see like
lighters blazing - specifically the
melodic bridge on reverse inverted or
the introduction on the track kiss me
Dooley I mean the overall mood of this
album is really uplifting and just
positive even the slower and heavier
moments on this LP have a very positive
vibe to them I think like the track
solitary traveler which has these
numerous layers of guitars just creating
a really heavy atmosphere and the song
actually reminds me of a few tracks from
torches previous LP me and earth all but
it uses its heaviness to be heavenly the
volume of this album the ribs the solos
all of it brings together this feeling
of just overwhelming joy rarely is an
album this loud and this pummeling is
throttling joyous and I like how torch
work to really make every song on here
have its own personality to an extent
the track letting go which is the intro
on here sets the really bright uplifting
tone for this LP the drumbeat on the
song and the vocal melody - just makes
me feel like I'm about to embark on this
epic metal fantasy journey the track
kicking right after it is one of the
catchiest tracks on here very melodic
guitars over the verse and the the
build-up up to the hook is just massive
and when the hook finally kicks in and
just slows everything down and brings
those massive guitar riffs and it's just
pure ecstasy and the track reverse
inverted as a fan
to cook and is very much one of the
slower and heavier songs on the album
but throws out this off-kilter sort of
groove this off time signature that is
played out very naturally by these guys
yeah the track sky trials is the
shortest on here for me just just over a
minute in length and extremely faster to
the point really epic vocal part at the
end and I loved how it segues into the
song roaming right after even though a
lot of these songs are very catchy very
very poppy torch really has an obvious
focus on the overall flow of the album
with how one song will sort of hit just
as another one meets maybe a sudden stop
the title track on here is a really
tight instrumental and just like on me
and earth all torch saves its heaviest
and darkest moments for the end of the
LP the closer which it's pretty heavy in
comparison to other tracks on this album
but the band has definitely been heavier
in the past and I think the band
replaces that darker and just more
brutal mood with something that is
adequate for me in a way and I feel like
a lot of people could come by this and
say hey you know what this is just kind
of a torch as usual album even though
the group is making efforts to change
its sound up a little bit to the point
where I think people who are not even
into metal and loud rock can enjoy this
thing maybe I am splitting hairs a
little bit and separating torch from the
rest of the pack more than some people
would but the only album in in recent
memory for me that has taken such a
heavy sound and tried to make it so easy
and fun to listen to is possibly that
last Mastodon record the hunter and and
I was really into that record as far as
sludge stoner doom metal whatever you
want to call it goes torch for me is the
sweetest band out there it's pretty much
like doom desert not something I'd want
to eat every single minute of the
day this album is by this music
standards pretty sugary still very
pivotal part of the meal if you've got a
room for it kind of feeling a light to
decent ate on this thing you guys think
of this LP do you love it do you hate it
why I think you should try it out and
maybe try to answer some of those
questions for me be nice
love you Anthony Fantana torch forever
